Debug Player
  • Installation
  • View page source

Installation

This page provides instructions for installing Debug Player and its dependencies.

Prerequisites

  • Python 3.12 or higher

  • pip (Python package manager)

  • Git (for development)

Installation Methods

Using pip (recommended)

pip install debug-player

From source

  1. Clone the repository:

    git clone https://github.com/imagry/debug-player.git
cd debug-player

  2. Install in development mode:

    pip install -e .[dev]

    This will install the package in development mode along with all development dependencies.

Dependencies

Core Dependencies

  • PySide6 >= 6.5.0

  • numpy >= 1.24.0

  • pandas >= 2.0.0

  • pyyaml >= 6.0

  • python-dateutil >= 2.8.2

  • pytz >= 2023.3

  • scipy >= 1.10.0

  • matplotlib >= 3.7.0

  • importlib-metadata >= 6.0.0

  • importlib-resources >= 5.12.0

  • colorama >= 0.4.6

  • rich >= 13.0.0

Development Dependencies

Development dependencies are listed in the pyproject.toml file under [project.optional-dependencies].

Verifying the Installation

To verify that Debug Player is installed correctly, run:

python -c "import debug_player; print(f'Debug Player version: {debug_player.__version__}')"

Troubleshooting

Common Issues

  1. Missing Dependencies If you encounter errors about missing dependencies, try installing them manually:

    pip install -r requirements/base.txt

  2. Qt Platform Plugin If you see an error about a missing Qt platform plugin, make sure you have the necessary Qt libraries installed. On Ubuntu/Debian:

    sudo apt-get install libxcb-xinerama0 libxcb-cursor0 libxkbcommon-x11-0 libqt6charts6

  3. Permission Errors If you encounter permission errors, try using the --user flag with pip:

    pip install --user debug-player

    Or use a virtual environment:

    python -m venv venv
source venv/bin/activate  # On Windows: venv\Scripts\activate
pip install debug-player

Getting Help

If you encounter any issues during installation, please check the GitHub issues page to see if your issue has already been reported. If not, please open a new issue with details about your environment and the error message you’re seeing.
